result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey Joe Bigboy DOC# 392806 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture or Deliver Prescription Drug [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(9)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes:
Def to obtain domestic abuse/perpetrators counseling as directed and complete recommendations.
  Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed. Defendant may go to convenience/grocery store even if alcohol sold, may be present where alcohol is sold/served soley for seeking or maintaining employment. 
No possession of any prescription drugs except those exactly prescribed to the defendant.
Advise DOC what medication(s) are prescribed to him.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail.
NO face to face contact with CARISSA DEPERRY, may have electronic/telephonic/written contact for purposes of child care.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
Seek and maintain full time employment

supervisions.notes: All financials placed on payment plan $25-$50 per month beginning 1/5/16

Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department.
Granted Good Time
Granted Work and Child Care Release
Consecutive to: Ashland County case 16CM66 Count 4 and 16CF159 Count 11
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail
